body:
While working on #4483 I noticed that in `llnl.util.filesystem`:
```python
def find(root, files, recurse=True):
    ...
```
takes root as the first argument and the list of files as the second argument, while:
```python
def find_headers(headers, root, recurse=False):
    ...

def find_libraries(libraries, root, shared=True, recurse=False):
    ...
```
do the opposite. I think one of the two must be changed for the sake of consistency, as the functions provide basically the same semantic.
title: Inconsistent API for similar functions
